title: Dumping ipa file on iOS 10.2 [closed]
content:
Closed. This question is off-topic. It is not currently accepting answers. Questions asking for help reverse-engineering a specific system are off-topic unless they demonstrate an understanding of the concepts involved and clearly identify a specific problem. Closed 8 years ago. Improve this question Is there a way to dump .ipa file on iOS 10.2 (jailbroken) for future reverse-engineering? Tried to use Clutch, it doesn't dump the app. Just exits with 
2017-03-13 23:17:24.702 Clutch[2195:100953] application {name = 'NSOperationQueue 0x10bf909b0'}
2017-03-13 23:17:24.702 Clutch[2195:100919] application {name = 'NSOperationQueue 0x10bf0c9d0'}
errors.

answers_data.content:
So Installing ipainstaller through Cydia and then dumping with command (through ssh) 
ipainstaller -b com.example.targetapp -o /tmp/example.ipa
does the work
